00023 //A macro that actually memcpy's over data and increments the pointer automatically
00024 //based on the size.  Works like a FileRead except with a buffer instead of a file pointer.
00025 //Used by LoadWorld() and child functions.
00026 #include <memory.h>
00027 #define  LOADDATA( dst, src, size ) memcpy( dst, src, size ); src += size

00107 typedef struct TAG_level_node
00108 {
00109       struct TAG_level_node                     *pNext;
00110       UINT32                                                                  uiFlags;                                        // flags struct
00111 
00112       UINT8                                                                   ubSumLights;                              // LIGHTING INFO
00113       UINT8                                                                   ubMaxLights;                              // MAX LIGHTING INFO
00114 
00115       union 
00116       {
00117             struct TAG_level_node                     *pPrevNode;                         // FOR LAND, GOING BACKWARDS POINTER
00118             STRUCTURE                                                         *pStructureData;        // STRUCTURE DATA
00119             INT32                                                                   iPhysicsObjectID;       // ID FOR PHYSICS ITEM
00120             INT32                                                                   uiAPCost;                                 // FOR AP DISPLAY
00121             INT32                                                                   iExitGridInfo;                
00122       }; // ( 4 byte union )
00123 
00124       union 
00125       {
00126             struct
00127             {
00128                   UINT16                                                            usIndex;                                        // TILE DATABASE INDEX
00129                   INT16                                                             sCurrentFrame;                      // Stuff for animated tiles for a given tile location ( doors, etc )
00130             };
00131 
00132             SOLDIERTYPE                                                 *pSoldier;                                      // POINTER TO SOLDIER
00133 
00134       }; // ( 4 byte union )
00135 
00136       union 
00137       {
00138             // Some levelnodes can specify relative X and Y values!
00139             struct
00140             {
00141                   INT16                                                             sRelativeX;                                     // Relative position values
00142                   INT16                                                             sRelativeY;                                     // Relative position values
00143             };
00144 
00145             // Some can contains index values into dead corpses
00146             struct
00147             {
00148                   INT32                                                             iCorpseID;                                      // Index into corpse ID
00149             };
00150 
00151             struct
00152             {
00153                   UINT32                                                            uiAnimHitLocationFlags; // Animation profile flags for soldier placeholders ( prone merc hit location values )
00154             };
00155 
00156             // Some can contains index values into animated tile data
00157             struct
00158             {
00159                   struct TAG_anitile                        *pAniTile;
00160             };
00161 
00162             // Can be an item pool as well...
00163             struct
00164             {
00165                   ITEM_POOL                                                         *pItemPool;                         // ITEM POOLS
00166             };
00167 
00168 
00169       };
00170 
00171       INT16                                                                         sRelativeZ;                                     // Relative position values
00172       UINT8                                                                         ubShadeLevel;                                   // LIGHTING INFO
00173       UINT8                                                                         ubNaturalShadeLevel;          // LIGHTING INFO
00174       UINT8                                                                         ubFakeShadeLevel;                   // LIGHTING INFO
00175 
00176 } LEVELNODE;
